TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed CallingConventions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the valid calling conventions for a method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The native calling convention is the set of rules governing the order and layout of arguments passed to compiled methods. It also governs how to pass the return value, what registers to use for arguments, and whether the called or the calling method removes arguments from the stack.
## Examples [!code-cpp[Type_GetConstructor3#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.reflection.call_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Type_GetConstructor3#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.reflection.call_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Type_GetConstructor3#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.reflection.call_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.CallingConventions Any = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Specifies that either the or the calling convention may be used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.CallingConventions ExplicitThis = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the signature is a function-pointer signature, representing a call to an instance or virtual method (not a static method). If is set, must also be set. The first argument passed to the called method is still a pointer, but the type of the first argument is now unknown. Therefore, a token that describes the type (or class) of the pointer is explicitly stored into its metadata signature.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.CallingConventions HasThis = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Specifies an instance or virtual method (not a static method). At run-time, the called method is passed a pointer to the target object as its first argument (the pointer). The signature stored in metadata does not include the type of this first argument, because the method is known and its owner class can be discovered from metadata.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.CallingConventions Standard = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies the default calling convention as determined by the common language runtime. Use this calling convention for static methods. For instance or virtual methods use .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Reflection.CallingConventions VarArgs = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies the calling convention for methods with variable arguments.
